title: Tweed hair is officially a thing...would you wear it?
text:
Fashion and beauty are colliding thanks to the latest trend: Tweed hair color.

The two-toned look has a similar feel to a balayage treatment, only with more of a focused high-low mix of hues.

Chicago-based hair colorist at Maxine Salon, Rex Jimieson, posted a side-by-side photo of the trend that includes brunette and blonde tweed stitching on Instagram, and it has continued to catch the attention of many.

Jimieson advises in his post that the color should fill up your hair. The base and highlights should be within three levels of each other, and you should also incorporate your natural undertones so it's easy to wear.

Owner and educator Mallery Share at Simplicity Salon has been highlighting the trend on social media as well.

For the look above, Share says, "The less you paint the more dimension."

She used Kenra Lightner 30 vol with a single stroke hand-painted application. Then, she tones with Kenra's Rapid Toner in Violet Pearl and Beige.

Scroll ahead for a few more standout tweed hair looks and prepare to be inspired.

Will you be jumping in on this season's trending tweed hair?
